info.title: Order Management
info.description: **Expansion stage I - reading evaluation data:** Cumulated order and suborder data are provided via the interface, which can be further processed by the calling systems. **Consideration of rights management** The interface takes into account all locks that were set for the user in the rights management under . Users for whom such locks have been set do not get the orders or ordertypes that fall under this list. If all requested orders are blocked, the result set of the call is empty.

badRequest.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

unauthorized.description: No authorization to transfer the data.

RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable.description: Invalid pagination parameter -  Missing top value

NotFound.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

orderId.name: orderid
orderId.description: The ID of the order to be read/ written

SuborderId.name: suborderid
SuborderId.description: The ID of the suborder to be read/ written

Invoiceid.name: invoiceid
Invoiceid.description: The ID of the invoice to be read

ClientId.name: clientid
ClientId.description: The ID (GUID) of the client whose client-group is to be read. The client ID must be used without quotation marks in the URI.

Employee_Id.name: employee_id
Employee_Id.description: The ID (GUID) of the employee for whom capacities are to be read.

CostcenterID.name: costcenterid
CostcenterID.description: The ID of the costcenter of an order or an employee is assigned. A costcenter belongs exactly to one organization.

CostRate.name: costrate
CostRate.description:
(Bewertung mit Kostensatz) This ist only a valid parameter, if you request either the order object with the subordinate object **suborders** or the object **orders/monthlyvalues**.
With this parameter you can decide with which cost rate the time costs of the employees should be evaluated.
Valid entries are 1 - 9. If no cost rate is specified, the time costs are valued with cost rate 1.
If the entered cost rate is not consistently assigned to the employees, the value 0 will be returned.

AutomaticIntegration.name: automaticintegration
AutomaticIntegration.description:
(Automatische Integration) The parameter can be used to decide whether the expensepostings that are written to EO comfort via the interface are to be integrated directly into the orders or not. 
**true** - the expensepostings will be checked and if they are free of errors, they are integrated into the orders. Incorrect postings remain in the ZMA Massendatenerfassung and must be getting corrected.
**false** - the expensepostings are written into the ZMA Massendatenerfassung and must be manually integrated into the orders from there.

DeleteMassdataOnFailure.name: deletemassdataonfailure
DeleteMassdataOnFailure.description:
(Löschen der Massendatenerfassungssätze aufgrund von Fehlern beim Integrationsversuch, nur in Kombination mit dem Parameter “automaticintegration=true” verwendbar/wirksam) The parameter can be used to control whether erroneous expense postings, which can’t be integrated, should be deleted. If deletemassdataonfailure is set to true the erroneous expense posting will be deleted. If deletemassdataonfailure is set to false, it will remain and can be corrected using the EO Comfort application. This Parameter can only be used in combination with the parameter 'automaticintegration'. 
**true** - the expense posting will be checked to see if they have any errors and if so, it will be deleted in the ZKM-Massendatenerfassung. Incorrect postings will not remain in the ZKM-Massendatenerfassung in case of an automaticintegration attempt.
**false** - the expense posting will be checked and if they it is free of errors, it will be integrated into the order. An Incorrect posting remains in the ZKM-Massendatenerfassung.

get.summary: Read one order for a client from EO Comfort
get.description:
Read one order for a client from EO Comfort.

By using the **parameter expand** you can request the subordinate object suborders together with the information of the order object. 
You can only use the **parameter costrate** if you expand the subordinate object suborders. If the entered cost rate is not consistently assigned to the employees, the value 0 will be returned. 


**Predictable fields**


| cost_field  | calculation                |
|--------------------------|-----------------------------|
| planned_costs  | planned_time_costs + planned_expenses_costs + planned_material_costs + planned_external_costs |
| total_hours_invoicable | total_hours - total_hours_not_invoiced |
| **total costs**| |
| total_costs | time_costs + expenses_costs + material_costs + external_costs |
| total_costs (sales value)| time_costs (sales value) + expenses_costs (sales value) + material_costs (sales value) + external_costs |
| total_costs_not_invoiced | time_costs_not_invoiced + expenses_costs_not_invoiced + material_costs_not_invoiced + external_costs_not_invoiced |
| total_costs_invoicable | total_costs - total_costs_not_invoiced |
| **invoicable costs**| |
| time_costs_invoicable | time_costs - time_costs_not_invoiced |
| material_costs_invoicable | material_costs - material_costs_not_invoiced |
| expenses_costs_invoicable | expenses_costs - expenses_costs_not_invoiced |
| external_costs_invoicable | external_costs - external_costs_not_invoiced |

The calculation of the amounts valued with the sales value is carried out in the same way.  

The distinction of costs or hours into open and billed is based on the status of the suborder. If the field date_invoiced of the suborder is NULL, the costs and the hours are open - if the date_invoiced is filled, the costs and hours are billed.

| sales_field   | calculation                  |
|--------------------------|-----------------------------|
| credit_amount | credit_fees + credit_expenses |
| on_account_amount_offset | on_account_fees_offset + on_account_expenses_offset |

put.description:
With the **PUT command** the order will be **completely overwritten**. We therefore recommend to
do a request of the order which is going to be updated. This is to prevent losing data of the order by being overwritten.

**The following properties can be changed by using the PUT command:**

**responsibilities**
- order_responsible1_id
- order_responsible2_id
- order_partner_id

**status**
- completion_status 
  interrupted: employee and interruption date are defined by current date and user
  done: completion date and employee are defined by current date and user 
  resumed: can only be set if current status is 'interrupted', resumed date and employee are defined by current date and user
  work completed: date and employee are defined by current date and user

**planning**
- planned_start
- planned_end
- planned_turnover
- planned_hours_time_units
- planned_time_costs
- planned_expenses_costs
- planned_material_costs
- planned_external_costs

**All other properties can't be changed by using the PUT command**

204.description: The order has been updated successfully.

Link.description: The link contains a self-reference with the ID of the updated object.

get.summary: Read all orders for clients from EO Comfort - the result can be limited by using filter parameters
get.description:
Read all orders for clients from EO Comfort - the result can be limited by using **filter parameters**. By using the **parameter expand** you can request the subordinate object suborders together with the information of the order object. You can only use the **parameter costrate** if you expand the subordinate object suborders. If the entered cost rate is not consistently assigned to the employees, the value 0 will be returned. **Predictable fields** | cost_field | calculation | |--------------------------|-----------------------------| | planned_costs | planned_time_costs + planned_expenses_costs + planned_material_costs + planned_external_costs | | total_hours_invoicable | total_hours - total_hours_not_invoiced | | **total costs**| | | total_costs | time_costs + expenses_costs + material_costs + external_costs | | total_costs (sales value) | time_costs (sales value) + expenses_costs (sales value) + material_costs (sales value) + external_costs | | total_costs_not_invoiced | time_costs_not_invoiced + expenses_costs_not_invoiced + material_costs_not_invoiced + external_costs_not_invoiced | | total_costs_invoicable | total_costs - total_costs_not_invoiced | | **invoicable costs** | | | time_costs_invoicable | time_costs - time_costs_not_invoiced | | material_costs_invoicable | material_costs - material_costs_not_invoiced | | expenses_costs_invoicable | expenses_costs - expenses_costs_not_invoiced | | external_costs_invoicable | external_costs - external_costs_not_invoiced | The calculation of the amounts valued with the sales value is carried out in the same way. The distinction of costs or hours into open and billed is based on the status of the suborder. If the field date_invoiced of the suborder is NULL, the costs and the hours are open - if the date_invoiced is filled, the costs and hours are billed. | sales_field | calculation | |--------------------------|-----------------------------| | credit_amount | credit_fees + credit_expenses | | on_account_amount_offset | on_account_fees_offset + on_account_expenses_offset | **Filter Options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - creation_year - order_number - order_name - assessment_year - fiscal_year - ordertype - ordertype_group - isinternal - organization_id - establishment_id - functional_area_id - client_id - completion_status - billing_status - file_number - order_id - automatic_fee_active - automatic_fee_level - invoice_type **Operators** ***Filter Option: creation_year, order_number, assessment_year, fiscal_year, order_id, automatic_fee_level*** | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | | gt | Greater than | | ge | Greater than or equal | | lt | Less than | | le | Less than or equal | ***Filter Option: order_name, ordertype, ordertype_group, organization_id, establishment_id, functional_area_id, client_id, file_number, automatic_fee_active, invoice_type*** | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | ***Filter Option: isinternal*** | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | *Valid entries for this filter option are:* - true - only internal orders - false - only orders for clients - no filtering - all orders ***Filter Option: completion_status*** | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | *Valid entries for filtering the completion_status are:* - started - created/planned - interrupted - done - 'work completed' - 'work partially completed' ***Filter Option: billing_status*** | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | *Valid entries for filtering the billing_status are:* - invoiced - 'partially invoiced' - 'advance payment partially invoiced' - 'advance invoiced' - open **Remarks** - Filters can be combined using the operators "and" or "or" .
- Each filter option may only be used once in a request. **URI Examples** - Retrieving the orders of a client with the client id 'd13f9c3c-380c-494e-97c8-d12fff738189' .../orders?filter=client_id eq d13f9c3c-380c-494e-97c8-d12fff738189

- Retrieving the order of the assessment_year is greater than or equal to 2018 .../orders?filter=assessment_year ge 2018

- Retrieving orders with an automatic fee and automatic fee level 2 .../orders?filter=automatic_fee_active eq true and automatic_fee_level eq 2

- Retrieving orders with an invoice_type AKO (Akontorechnung) .../orders?filter=invoice_type eq AKO

**Paging** - When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request. - Please use top and skip for this purpose. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | top | Number of orders that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=50 | | skip | Number of orders that should be skipped. Example: skip=50 |

get.summary: Read all monthly values of exactly one order from EO comfort
get.description:
Read all monthly values of exactly one order from EO comfort. The costs and sales of the orders are totaled monthly. The working date of the employee's activities for the order is decisive for the time allocation of the costs. The sales values are assigned to a month according to the invoice date. **Predictable fields** | cost_field | calculation | |--------------------------|-----------------------------| | total_hours_invoicable | total_hours - total_hous_not_invoiced | |**total costs**| | | total_costs | time_costs + expenses_costs + material_costs + external_costs | | total_costs (sales value)| time_costs (sales value) + expenses_costs (sales value) + material_costs (sales value) + external_costs (sales_value) | | total_costs_not_invoiced | time_costs_not_invoiced + expenses_costs_not_invoiced + material_costs_not_invoiced + external_costs_not_invoiced | | total_costs_invoicable | total_costs - total_costs_not_invoiced | | **invoicable costs** | | | time_costs_invoicable | time_costs - time_costs_not_invoiced | | material_costs_invoicable | material_costs - material_costs_not_invoiced | | expenses_costs_invoicable | expenses_costs - expenses_costs_not_invoiced | | external_costs_invoicable | external_costs - external_costs_not_invoiced | The calculation of the amounts valued with the sales value is carried out in the same way.
| sales_field | calculation | |--------------------------|-----------------------------| | credit_amount | credit_fees + credit_expenses | | on_account_amount_offset | on_account_fees_offset + on_account_expenses_offset | | contribution_margin | total_turnover - total_costs | | contribution_margin (sales_value) | total_turnover - total_costs (sales_value) |

200.description: List of monthly values for the selected order

get.summary: Read all monthly values of orders from EO comfort - the result can be limited by using parameters
get.description:
Read all monthly values of orders from EO comfort - the result can be limited by using parameters. The costs and sales of the orders are totaled monthly. The working date of the employee's activities for the order is decisive for the time allocation of the costs. The sales values are assigned to a month according to the invoice date. The values are sorted according to the oldest monthly value. The top and skip parameter can be used to control how many monthly values are to be listed. **Predictable fields** | cost_field | calculation | |--------------------------|-----------------------------| | total_hours_invoicable | total_hours - total_hous_not_invoiced | | **total costs** | | | total_costs | time_costs + expenses_costs + material_costs + external_costs | | total_costs (sales value) | time_costs (sales value) + expenses_costs (sales value) + material_costs (sales value) + external_costs (sales_value) | | total_costs_not_invoiced | time_costs_not_invoiced + expenses_costs_not_invoiced + material_costs_not_invoiced + external_costs_not_invoiced | | total_costs_invoicable | total_costs - total_costs_not_invoiced | | **invoicable costs** | | | time_costs_invoicable | time_costs - time_costs_not_invoiced | | material_costs_invoicable | material_costs - material_costs_not_invoiced | | expenses_costs_invoicable | expenses_costs - expenses_costs_not_invoiced | | external_costs_invoicable | external_costs - external_costs_not_invoiced | The calculation of the amounts valued with the sales value is carried out in the same way. | sales_field | calculation | |--------------------------|-----------------------------| | credit_amount | credit_fees + credit_expenses | | on_account_amount_offset | on_account_fees_offset + on_account_expenses_offset | | contribution_margin | total_turnover - total_costs | | contribution_margin (sales_value) | total_turnover - total_costs (sales_value) | **Filter Options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - ordertype - ordertype_group - client_id - organization_id - establishment_id - functional_area_id - isinternal - year **Operators** ***Filter Option: year*** | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | If the year is not limited by a filter, the year of the current system date will be used for filtering. ***Filter Option: ordertype, ordertype_group, organization_id, establishment_id,functional_area_id, client_id*** | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | ***Filter Option: isinternal*** | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | *Valid entries for this filter option are:* - true - only internal orders - false - only orders for clients - no filtering - all orders **Remarks** - Filters can be combined using the operators "and" or "or" .
- Each filter option may only be used once in a request. **URI Examples** - Retrieving the orders of a client with the client id 'd13f9c3c-380c-494e-97c8-d12fff738189' .../orders/monthlyvalues?filter=number eq 'd13f9c3c-380c-494e-97c8-d12fff738189'

- Retrieving the monthly values of the year 2020 of all orders belonging to the ordertype_group 50 .../orders/monthlyvalues?filter=ordertype_group eq 50 and year eq 2020

**Paging** - When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request.
- Please use top and skip for this purpose. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | top | Number of monthly values that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=50 | | skip | Number of monthly values that should be skipped. Example: skip=50 |

get.summary: Read all cost items of orders from EO comfort - the result can be limited by using parameters
get.description:
Read all cost items of orders from EO comfort - the result can be limited by using parameters. The top and skip parameter can be used to control how many coste items are to be listed. **Filter Options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - order_id - creation_year - order_number - suborder_id - suborder_number - cost_postion - cost_type (possible values: ZEI (time-costs), AUS (expenses-costs), MAT (material-costs), FRK (external costs)) - fee_position - fee_plan_number - unit_description **Operators** ***Filter Option: cost_postion, cost_type, fee_position, unit_description *** | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | ***Filter Option: order_id, creation_year, order_number, suborder_id, suborder_number, fee_plan_number*** | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | | gt | Greater than | | ge | Greater than or equal | | lt | Less than | | le | Less than or equal | **Remarks** - Filters can be combined using the operators "and" or "or" .
- Each filter option may only be used once in a request. **URI Examples** - Retrieving the cost items with an order number greater than 200 and order creation year 2025 .../orders/costitems?filter=order_number gt 200 and creation_year eq 2025

- Retrieving the cost items with cost type "time-costs" .../orders/costitems?filter=cost_type eq ZEI

- Retrieving the cost items with unit description 'Kilometer' .../orders/costitems?filter=unit_description eq Kilometer

**Paging** - When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request.
- Please use top and skip for this purpose. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | top | Number of cost items that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=50 | | skip | Number of cost items that should be skipped. Example: skip=50 |

get.summary: Read order state dates from EO comfort - the result can be restricted by using filter parameters. If no filters and no skip  or top parameters have been set, only a limited amount of entries may be returned. For accessing single orders the endpoint /orders/{orderid}/orderstatework can be used.
get.description:
Read order state dates from EO comfort - the result can be restricted by using **filter parameters**. **Filter options** The result can be **restricted** by using one or more of the following **filter parameters**: - creation_year (int) - order_number (int) - order_id (int) - creation_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) - start_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) - done_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) - interruption_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) - resume_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) - completion_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) **Operators** ***Filter Option: creation_year, order_number, order_id, creation_date, start_date, done_date, interruption_date, resume_date, completion_date*** | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | | gt | Greater than | | ge | Greater than or equal | | lt | Less than | | le | Less than or equal | **Remarks** - Filters can be combined using the operators "and" or "or" .
- Each filter option may only be used once in a request. **URI Examples** - Retrieving order state dates for orders created in 2024 .../orders/orderstatework?filter=creation_year eq 2024

- Retrieving 100 order state dates with order numbers greater than 100 and creation year 2024 .../orders/orderstatework?filter=creation_year eq 2024 and order_number gt 100&top=100

- Retrieving order state dates with an interruption date greater than 01.01.2020 .../orders/orderstatework?filter=interruption_date gt '01.01.2020'

**Paging** - When accessing large quantities of data, it may happen that these cannot be delivered in a single request. In this case, paging has to be used in order to reduce the amount of data in a single request.
- Please use top and skip for this purpose. |Parameter|Description | |:------:|-----------------------------------------------------------------| | top | Number of orders that should be read as a result of the request. Example: top=50 | | skip | Number of orders that should be skipped. Example: skip=50 |

200.description: List of orders with their current state dates.

do a request of the suborder which is going to be updated. This is to prevent losing data of the suborder by being overwritten.

**The following properties can be changed by using the PUT command:**

**Suborder**
- planned_hours_time_units
- date_work_completed
- planned_start
- planned_end

**All other properties can't be changed by using the PUT command**

The result can be limited by using filter parameters. **Filter Options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - employee_id - work_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) - entry_date (format i.e.: 01.01.2024) - order_id **Operators** ***Filter Option: work_date, entry_date, order_id*** | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | | gt | Greater than | | ge | Greater than or equal | | lt | Less than | | le | Less than or equal | ***Filter Option: employee_id*** | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | ne | Not equal | **Remarks** - Filters can be combined using the operators "and" or "or" .

post.summary: Creates new expense postings for one suborder in EO comfort
post.description:
Creates new expense postings for one suborder in EO comfort
**Attention: List of relevant fields for the POST of an expense posting depending on the cost type, the calculation type and the calculation unit** The use of calculation bases when posting an expense posting depends on the cost type and, if applicable, the calculation type of the underlying standard cost position. These are stored in EO comfort in the application "Standardaufwandspositionen". If further fields are filled in addition to the valid fields, this can lead to incorrect calculations when integrating the expense posting into EO comfort. | costtype | allowed fields | additional description | |-------------------|-----------------------------|--------------------------| | time-costs | start_time | for items with the unit "hours" – must be used together with time_units | | | time_units | for items with the unit "hours" | | | number_of_days | for items with the unit "days" | | material-costs | number_of units | calculation type "quantity" | | | cost_amount | calculation type "amount" | | expenses-costs | number_of units | calculation type "quantity" | | | cost_amount | calculation type "amount" | | external-costs | cost_amount | |
**Attention: The field entry_date from the model could not be posted.**

201.description: The expenseposting has been inserted successfully.

Location.description: In case of automaticintegration=true the link contains a self-reference of the ID of order and suborder in which the posted expenseposting is inserted.

Example: top=50 | | skip | Number of orders that should be skipped. Example: skip=50 | **Additional notes** The difference between **invoice date** and **document date** is related to two different facts in bookeeping: # (1) due date (2) accounting period. # The **invoice date** is related to the **due** date on which the payment of the invoice has to be done.The **document date** defines the **accounting** period to which the invoice is booked.

ordertype_id.description: ID Auftragsart | Unique internal ID of an order type within EO comfort.

ordertype_name.description: Auftragsart Bezeichnung | Designation of the types of orders of the company.

active.description: Kennzeichen aktiv| Flag to indicate if an order type is in use, true - active, false - not active.

isinternal.description: Kennzeichen interner Auftrag | Flag used to indicate if an order is for internal use or for client use.

ordertype_group.description: Auftragsartengruppe | Short name of an order type group which allows to group similar orders.

ordertype_group_name.description: Auftragsartengruppenbezeichnung | Full name of an order type group.

ordertype_group_id.description: ID Auftragsartengruppe | Unique internal ID of an order type group within EO comfort.

id.description: ID | Unique identifier of the object.

client_id.description: ID Mandant | Internal ID of the client for which an order is created. Further data about the client can be obtained via the Master Data interface.

client_group.description: Kurzbezeichnung Mandantengruppe | short name of a client group the client belongs to which is a possibility to group clients for controlling or billing reasons.

client_group_name.description: Bezeichnung Mandantengruppe | Name of the group to which the client belongs.

id.description: ID | Unique identifier of the object.

order_id.description: ID Auftrag | Unique technical key of the order.

creation_year.description: Anlagejahr | Year in which the order was created.

order_number.description: Auftragsnummer | Sequential number of an order within a year. The combination of creation year and order number is the key of an order but not in a technical sense.

creation_year_predecessor.description: Anlagejahr Vorgängerauftrag | Creation year of preceding order.

order_number_predecessor.description: Auftragsnummer Vorgängerauftrag | Number of preceding order.

creation_year_successor.description: Anlagejahr Nachfolgerauftrag | Creation year of succeeding order.

order_number_successor.description: Auftragsnummer Nachfolgerauftrag | Number of succeeding order.

order_name.description: Gesamtauftrag Bezeichnung | Name of the order, default value is set by the ordertype name.

ordertype.description: Auftragsart Kurzbezeichnung | Short name for the order type. The value is set by the ordertype name and cannot be changed.

ordertype_group.description: Auftragsartengruppe | Short name of an order type group which allows to group similar orders.

assessment_year.description: Veranlagungsjahr (VJ)| The Year of the tax declaration, balance sheet, payroll or other services renderd for the client and to be registered and/ or billed using the order.

fiscal_year.description: Wirtschaftsjahr (WJ) | An option which has to be activated in the 'Konfiguration' and could be used to relate all values of the order to one business year.

isinternal.description: Kennzeichen interner Auftrag | Flag used to indicate that an order is for internal use.

organization_id.description: ID Unternehmen | Internal ID of the company for which the order is created. Further data to the company can be obtained in the desktop API Client Master Data.

establishment_id.description: ID Niederlassung | Internal ID of a branch of the company for which the order is created. Further data to the branch can be obtained in the desktop API Client Master Data.

functional_area_id.description: ID Sachgebiet | Internal ID of a subject area of the company for which the order is created. Further data to the functional area can be obtained in the desktop API Client Master Data.

cost_center.description: Kostenstellenbezeichnung kurz | Short name of a cost center for which the order is created.

cost_center_name.description: Kostenstellenbezeichnung | Full name of a cost center for which the order is created.

order_responsible1_id.description: ID Mitarbeiter 1 | Internal ID of the employee who has the role 'Mitarbeiter 1' in the order.

order_responsible2_id.description: ID Mitarbeiter 2 | Internal ID of the employee who has the role 'Mitarbeiter 2' in the order.

order_partner_id.description: ID Partner | Internal ID of the employee who has the role 'Partner' in the order.

client_responsible_id.description: ID Mandatsverantwortlicher Mitarbeiter | Internal ID of the employee who has the role 'Mandatsverantwortung' in the master data of the client. The data are shown in the order but could not be changed here.

client_id.description: ID Mandant | Internal ID of the client for which the order is created. Further data to the client can be obtained in the desktop API Client Master Data.

  Example:
  /datev/api/law/v1/files?filter=file_number eq 000021-2007/001:00

max_planned_end.description: Planwerte des Gesamtauftrags 'Plan spätestes Ende' | Latest planned date on which work on the Order should be completed.

planned_material_costs.description: Planwerte des Gesamtauftrags 'Materialkosten'. Planned material costs for the order in Euro.

planned_external_costs.description: Planwerte des Gesamtauftrags 'Fremdkosten'. Planned third-party costs for the order in Euro.

comment.description: Kommentar | Comment to the costs which are recorded.

invoice_type.description:
Rechnungstyp | The type of invoice is important especially in case of credit notes (GUT) because all amounts are delivered as values greater than zero even for credit notes. Possible values:
  
  RG (Rechnung) - Invoice
  AKO (Akontorechnung) - Account invoice
  AKG (Akontogegenrechnung) - Account final invoice
  GUT (Gutschrift) - Credit note
  VOR (Vorschussrechnung) - Advance invoice
  VOG (Vorschussgegenrechnung) - Advance final invoice
  MIX (nicht eindeutig bestimmbar), z.B. zusammengefasste Rechnung aus mehreren Aufträgen mit unterschiedlichen Typen - Invoice not clearly determinable, i.e. consolidated invoice consisting of orders with different types

cancellation_flag.description: Kennzeichen Storno | Flag that indicates of whether an invoice is cancelled or not. true - cancelled, false - not cancelled

e_invoice_delivery.description:
Kennzeichen E-Rechnung | The delivery type of an e-invoice. Possible values:
  KEI (Nein) - Not an E-Invoice
  DRV (Digitale Rechnung/ E-Mail Versand) - Digital invoice
  DRD (Digitale Rechnung/ DUo) - Digital invoice with DATEV Unternehmen online                         
  ERE (ZUGfeRD 1.0/ E-Mail) - ZUGFeRD 1.0
  ERD (ZUGfeRD 1.0/ DUo) - ZUGFeRD 1.0 with DATEV Unternehmen online
  XRE (E-Rechnung) - E-Invoice
  XRD (E-Rechnung/ DUo) - E-Invoice with DATEV Unternehmen online

fees.description: Gebühren | Total of fees for the invoice. on the order.

on_account_fees_offset.description: Differenz aus Akonto Zahlungen und Gebühren der Schlussrechnung | Total advance payments for fees which are offset with the invoice.

on_account_expenses_offset.description: Differenz aus Akonto Zahlungen für Auslagen und den Auslagen der Schlussrechnung | Total advance payments for expenses which are offset with the invoice.

advance.description: Vorschuss | Total advance payments for fees within the invoice.

advance_offset.description: gegengerechneter Vorschuss | Total advance payments for fees which are offset with the invoice.

document_id.description: ID Dokument | Internal ID of the invoice document. Further data about the document can be obtained in the desktop API Document Management.

receipt_accounting_id.description: ID Beleg (Beleglink) | Internal ID of the invoice receipt which is used to link document with the accounting postings in the accounting software. Further data about the document can be obtained int the desktop API Accounting.

order_id.description: ID Auftrag | Unique technical key of the order.

creation_year.description: Anlagejahr | Year in which the order was created.

order_number.description: Auftragsnummer | Sequential number of an order within a year. The combination of creation year and order number is the key of an order but not in a technical sense.

suborder_number.description: Teilauftragsnummer | Sequential number of an suborder within an order. The combination of creation year, order number and suborder number is a key of a suborder but not in a technical sense.

id.description: Technische ID | Technical id of the subinvoice. In this case a random ID. DATEV Connect requires an "ID" Property in every dataset which is unique over all datasets returned.

Technische ID | Technical id of the employee-capacity. In this case a unique combination of employee_id and yearday (year followed by the day of the year). DATEV Connect requires an "ID" Property in every dataset which is unique over all datasets returned.

employee_id.description: ID Mitarbeiter | Internal ID of the employee for whom capacity information are stored in EO comfort. Further data of the employee can be obtained in the API Client Master Data.

date.description: Datum | The date for which the capacites of an employee in EO comfort are defined.

total_hours_time_units.description: Stunden gesamt, Zeiteinheiten | Total of hours from the working model of the employee which is calculated from target hours plus overtime hours which are defined as predictable hours contracted per day. 1h = 1200 time units

target_hours_time_units.description: Sollstunden, Zeiteinheiten | Hours contracted per day and stored of the working model of the employee in EO comfort. 1h = 1200 time units

predictable_overtime_hours_time_units.description: Planbare Überstunden, Zeiteinheiten | Overtime hours which could be used for the planning of orders and which are part of the working model of the employee in EO comfort. 1h = 1200 time units

unpredictable_hours_time_units.description: Stunden nicht planbar, Zeiteinheiten | Hours per day which could not be used for the planning of orders and  which are part of the working model of the employee in EO comfort. 1h = 1200 time units

planned_hours_time_units.description: Stunden geplant, Zeiteinheiten | Hours used for the planning of orders per day. 1h = 1200 time units

spare_hours_time_units.description: Stunden frei, Zeiteinheiten | Hours which are not yet used for planning per day. 1h = 1200 time units

employee_id.description: ID Mitarbeiter | Internal ID of the employee for whom group information are stored in EO comfort. Further data of the employee can be obtained in the API Client Master Data. In this case, same as the "id" property.

employee_group_id.description: Gruppennummer | Number of the employee group.

employee_group_id_guid.description: ID Mitarbeitergruppe | ID of the employee group as guid.

employee_group_short_name.description: Gruppe Kurzbezeichnung | Short name of the group.

employee_group_long_name.description: Gruppe Langbezeichnung | Long name of the group.

id.description: Technische ID | Id of the employee.  DATEV Connect requires an "ID" Property in every dataset which is unique over all datasets returned. In this case, same as employee_id.

employee_id.description: ID Mitarbeiter | Internal ID of the employee for whom group information are stored in EO comfort. Further data of the employee can be obtained in the API Client Master Data.

qualification_category.description: Kategorie der Qualifikation (1-3) | Category of the qualification (1-3).

qualification_short_name.description: Qualifikation Kurzbezeichnung | Short name of the qualification.

qualification_long_name.description: Qualifikation Langbezeichnung/Beschreibung | Long name/description of the qualification.

qualification_date_from.description: Datum von | Date from which the qualification is valid.

qualification_date_to.description: Datum bis | Date to which the qualification is valid.

employee_associate.description: Kennzeichen Partner | Indicates if the employee is a partner/associate.

employee_qualified.description: Kennzeichen Berufsangehöriger | Indicates if the employee is qualified.

qualification_active.description: Kennzeichen Qualifikation aktiv | Indicates if the qualification is active (true) or not (false).

id.description: Technische ID | Id of the qualification.  DATEV Connect requires an "ID" Property in every dataset which is unique over all datasets returned.

employee_id.description: ID Mitarbeiter | Internal ID of the employee for whom cost rate information are stored in EO comfort. Further data of the employee can be obtained in the API Client Master Data.

cost_rate_number.description: Kostensatznummer | Number of the cost rate.

cost_rate_date_from.description: Datum von | Date from which the cost rate is valid.

cost_rate_date_to.description: Datum bis | Date to which the cost rate is valid.

internal_charge_rate_clientorders.description: Interner Stundensatz für Mandantenaufträge | Intenral charge rate for client orders.

cost_rate_active.description: Kennzeichen Kostensatz aktiv | Indicates if the cost rate is active (true) or not (false).

id.description: Technische ID | Id of the cost rate.  DATEV Connect requires an "ID" Property in every dataset which is unique over all datasets returned. In this case, same as cost_rate_number.

charge_rate_number.description: Verrechnungssatznummer | Number of the charge rate.

employee_id.description: ID Mitarbeiter | Internal ID of the employee for whom the charge rate is stored in EO comfort. Further data of the employee can be obtained in the API Client Master Data.

organization_id.description: ID Unternehmen | Internal ID of the company for which the charge rate is for. Further data to the company can be obtained in the desktop API Client Master Data.

charge_rate_date_to.description: Datum bis | Date to which the charge rate is valid.

client_group.description: Mandantengruppe | Client group from EO Comfort.

client_group_type_id.description: Mandantengruppe | Client group technical ID (can be used with master-data API and client-group endpoints)

order_type.description: Auftragsart Kurzbezeichnung | Short name of the order type.

order_type_group_id.description: ID Auftragsartengruppe | Id order type group.

order_creation_year.description: Anlagejahr | Creation year of the order.

charge_rate_hour.description: Verrechnungssatz pro Stunde | Hourly charge rate.

charge_rate_day.description: Verrechnungssatz pro Tag | Daily charge rate.

costcenter_name_short.description: Kostenstellenbezeichnung kurz | Shortname or number of the cost-center which frequently corresponds to the cost-center number in the accounting system.

costcenter_active.description: Kostenstelle aktiv | Flag that indicates if the costcenter is active (true) or not (false).

costcenter_group.description: Kostenstellengruppe | The group of costcenters allows to group different costcenters for reporting reasons.

suborder_number.description: Teilauftragsnummer | Sequential number of an suborder within an order. The combination of creation year, order number and suborder number is a key of a suborder but not in a technical sense.

fee_plan_number.description: Gebührenplannummer | Number of the fee list to which every default position belongs. The list is part of the functional key of every fee position.

object_number.description: Objektnummer | Object number which is an optional value to add more than one of the same fee position to an order/ suborder. Frequently used for V+V objects in german tax declaration.

time_units.description: Zeiteinheiten | Time units. (1 hour has 1200 units)
